radiographic_examinations.findings: Echodense aortic valve with a definite echodense lesion (size, 0.9 cm x 0.9 cm) at the junction of the right and left coronary cusps, jet of aortic regurgitation visible on Doppler sonography.
Confirmed the presence of the abnormality attached to the left coronary cusp of the valve, repeated echocardiography revealed a perforated left coronary cusp and an aortic root abscess.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Appearance changed from initial findings to perforation and an abscess.
